data.title: Newcomer will like new nickname
data.meta_description: We’re not sure the reason behind the sudden run on players from the same school, other than an obvious connection to the nickname, but the Lions definitely seem to…
data.text:
Article content

We’re not sure the reason behind the sudden run on players from the same school, other than an obvious connection to the nickname, but the Lions definitely seem to like, well, Lions.

A third member of the University of North Alabama Lions, linebacker Michael Johnson, is expected to be announced shortly as the newest member of the CFL team. Johnson won’t have trouble spotting familiar faces of course, as DLs Montrell Craft and Dominie Pittman come from the same school in Florence, Ala.

We apologize, but this video has failed to load.

Try refreshing your browser, or

tap here to see other videos from our team.

Newcomer will like new nickname Back to video

North Alabama has had 18 players drafted over the years but is best known for its coach, Terry Bowden, who spent five years at Auburn and is the son of Florida State legend Bobby Bowden.

Johnson, listed at 6’4″ and 250 pounds, was a four-year starter at middle linebacker for a school which up until this year had never staged a single pro day.
